p: The baseline model parameters are estimates for the general population and our best guess from the literature. The relative sensitivity indices for these parameters ( Table 5) can be used to predict how slightly different assumptions about these input parameters will change the basic reproduction number. The relative sensitivity analysis quantified the relative importance of the model parameters on the model predictions and can be used to quantify the importance of obtaining more accurate data to reduce the parameter uncertainty and improve the modelâ€™s predictability.
